result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orell Alexander Davis Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Orell Alexander Davis Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Orell Alexander Davis Jr.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference following case #21CF1848.  Defense requests a trial date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 07-14-2022

Defendant Orell Alexander Davis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a Status Conference. Defense requests adjournment. Case set next hearing as requested. Case is set to follow with case # 2021CF1848. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report

Defendant Orell Alexander Davis in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Court ordered the defendant to appear in person for all future court appearances.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 04-13-2022

Defendant Orell Alexander Davis in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Court took judicial notice of 08CF4877. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Petkovich. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.  All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in effect.

Defendant Orell Alexander Davis in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court raises cash bail.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court to address bail.  Defendant has not posted $750 cash bond ordered on 02-03-2022.  Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.  Court vacated preliminary hearing date set for 02-10-2022.
Defendant must turn himself into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff or post $750 cash bond by 02-06-2022.

Defendant Orell Alexander Davis in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ZOOM HEARING.  Case in court for initial appearance.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Filings Due scheduled for February 7, 2022.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
